Friends

class CodecManager

Detailed Description

Abstract video decoder base class. The sub-classes of this class provide the actual video decoder functionality API. The VideoDecoder sub-class instances are accessed by the clients via the CodecManager API.
See also:
CodecManager::OpenDecoder

CodecManager::CloseDecoder

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef void(* VideoDecoder::CbFrameDecoded)(ResultType result, void *context, const UINT8 HUGE *out_buf, UINT32 time_stamp)
 

Callback function that is invoked by the VideoDecoder when a frame has been decoded (and post-processed) and is ready for rendering.

Parameters:
result A result (error) code: Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
context A context (e.g. this pointer) that has been passed to the VideoDecoder object when RegisterCallbackFunctions has been invoked.
out_buf Pointer to the video output buffer with the decoded frame.
time_stamp Time stamp as retrieved from the frame headers (in milliseconds).
See also:
DecodeFrame

DecodePacket

RegisterCallbackFunctions

typedef void(* VideoDecoder::CbInBufferFree)(void *context, UINT8 HUGE *in_buf)
 

A callback function that is called by the VideoDecoder when a video input buffer is not used anymore by the decoder (as the data has been already decoded) and can be re-used.

Parameters:
context A context (e.g. this pointer) that has been passed to the VideoDecoder object when RegisterCallbackFunctions has been invoked.
in_buf Pointer to the free video input buffer.
See also:
RegisterCallbackFunctions

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum VideoDecoder::FlagsType
 

Bit flags used for DecodeFrame and DecodePacket functions. If a bit is set, the corresponding indication is true, e.g., if LastFrame bit is set, it indicates that this is the last frame in the stream/file.

Enumerator:
LastFrameFlag  Indicates if it is the last frame of the stream.
LastPacketInFrameFlag  Indicates if this is the last packet in a frame (only for DecodePacket).
ImmediateDecodingFlag  Indicates if the frame shall be decoded (and in case of combined device also rendered) immediately, i.e. the time stamp is ignored in that case.
GreatestValueOfFlagsType 

enum VideoDecoder::ParameterType
 

Parameter type. It is used by the SetParameters and GetParameters functions as well as by the corresponding callback functions.

Enumerator:
QualityLevel  This parameter has to be casted to UINT16. It defines the quality level of the decoder. The greater this value, the better the quality. In general, in dependency of this value the post-processsing features (Deinterlacing, Deringing & Deblocking) are enabled/disabled. 0 corresponds to default settings. If the value is greater than the maximum supported quality level (which can be retrieved via GetCapabilities), the maximum level shall be set. Only for SetParameters function.
EndOfParameterType 

Member Function Documentation

virtual ResultType VideoDecoder::AllocateOutputBuffers (  UINT8 &  buf_count,
UINT32 &  buf_len
)  [pure virtual]
 

Allocates a number of output buffers that are used to store the decoded (and post-processed) frames.

Parameters:
buf_count Desired number of buffers to be allocated in the output buffer array. If set to 0, the default number of buffers will be allocated. On return, the actual number of buffers, i.e., the VideoDecoder can adapt the number passed in by the caller if necessary.
buf_len Desired length (in bytes) of one output buffer (all buffers have the same length). If set to 0, the default length will be used. On return, the actual buffer length, i.e. the VideoDecoder can adapt the length passed in by the caller if necessary.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

Implemented in EmzH264Decoder, EmzMpeg4Decoder, AtiMpeg4Decoder, EmzH264Decoder, EmzMpeg4Decoder, and ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder.

virtual ResultType VideoDecoder::Close (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Closes and releases the video decoder. This method should be invoked as soon as the video decoder is not needed anymore to allow other video decoders to access the resources.

Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
Open

CodecManager::ReleaseDecoder

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Decoder, EmzH264Decoder, and EmzMpeg4Decoder.

virtual ResultType VideoDecoder::DecodeFrame (  const UINT8 HUGE *  in_buf,
UINT32  in_buf_len,
UINT16  flags,
UINT32  time_stamp
)  [pure virtual]
 

Decodes a video frame. The input buffer contains always one complete frame. The actual decoding is done asynchronously, i.e., when the decoding process has finished, the callback function CbVideoFrameDecoded will be invoked.

Parameters:
in_buf Pointer to the video input buffer (containing the encoded frame).
in_buf_len Length of the video input buffer (in bytes).
flags Bit flags as defined by the FlagsType enum indicating if it is the last frame in the stream/file.
time_stamp time stamp of the frame in milliseconds.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
CbFrameDecoded

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Decoder, EmzH264Decoder, and EmzMpeg4Decoder.

virtual ResultType VideoDecoder::DecodePacket (  const UINT8 HUGE *  in_buf,
UINT32  in_buf_len,
UINT16  flags
)  [pure virtual]
 

Decodes a video packet. Contains one or more packet but the packets are always complete. The actual decoding is done asynchronously, i.e., when a complete frame has been decoded, the callback function CbVideoFrameDecoded will be invoked.

Parameters:
in_buf Pointer to the video input buffer (containing the encoded packets)
in_buf_len Length of the video input buffer (in bytes).
flags Bit flags as defined by the FlagsType enum. It indicates if it is the last packet in the frame and if it is the last frame.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
CbFrameDecoded

Implemented in EmzH264Decoder, EmzMpeg4Decoder, AtiMpeg4Decoder, EmzH264Decoder, EmzMpeg4Decoder, and ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder.

virtual ResultType VideoDecoder::FlushBuffers (  CbResult  cb_video_decoder_flushed,
void *  context
)  [pure virtual]
 

Cleares all output and input buffers of the decoder. The currently active decoding process will complete as usual. After this the decoder deletes all pending DecodeFrame() requests and cleares all internal buffers of the decoder. The input buffers already given to the decoder will be released by the decoder at the capture buffer manager.

Parameters:
cb_video_decoder_flushed Callback function that is called when this operation has finished.
context Context (e.g. this pointer) that is passed in the callback function.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
CodecDevice::CbResult

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Decoder, EmzH264Decoder, and EmzMpeg4Decoder.

virtual ResultType VideoDecoder::GetCapabilities (  VideoCodecCapabilities &  caps  )  [pure virtual]
 

This function is used to retrieve the capabilities of the video decoder (VideoDecoder sub-class).

Parameters:
caps On return, it contains the capabilities. Note: The caller has to create this object (with arbitrary values) before calling this function. The passed object is then filled with the correct values by the VideoDecoder sub-class.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Decoder, EmzH264Decoder, and EmzMpeg4Decoder.

virtual ResultType VideoDecoder::GetCurrentVideoClockTime (  UINT32 &  time_ms  )  [pure virtual]
 

Gets the current video clock time. This feature is only available if the video decoder supports clock (see CodecManager::VideoDecoderInfo).

Parameters:
time_ms On return the current time (in milliseconds).
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Decoder, EmzH264Decoder, and EmzMpeg4Decoder.

virtual ResultType VideoDecoder::Open (  VideoDecoderInfo &  dec_info  )  [pure virtual]
 

Opens and initializes the video decoder. In general, when a decoder is opened, it is reserved for the caller and cannot be used by another caller. Thus, as soon as the video decoder is not needed anymore, it shall be released by using Close.

Parameters:
dec_info On return, it contains the video decoder info.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
Close

CodecManager::ObtainDecoder

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Decoder, EmzH264Decoder, and EmzMpeg4Decoder.

virtual ResultType VideoDecoder::RegisterCallbackFunctions (  void *  context,
CbFrameDecoded  cb_frame_decoded,
CbInBufferFree  cb_in_buf_free
)  [pure virtual]
 

Register callback functions.

Parameters:
context A context (e.g. this pointer) that is valid for all callback functions registered with this instance of the VideoDecoder. This context is then passed as an argument of all callback functions invoked by the VideoDecoder.
cb_frame_decoded A pointer to a callback function that is invoked by the VideoDecoder when a frame has been decoded (and post-processed) and is ready for rendering.
cb_in_buf_free A pointer to a callback function that is called by the VideoDecoder when a video input buffer is not used anymore by the decoder (as the data has been already decoded) and can be re-used.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

virtual ResultType VideoDecoder::ReleaseOutputBuffer (  const UINT8 HUGE *  out_buf  )  [pure virtual]
 

Releases the specified output buffer of the decoder and, thus, allows the decoder to fill it with new decoded (and post-processed) frames if available. In general, this function is called when the frame stored in the buffer shall not been rendered at all or it has been rendered but the buffer has not been released automatically.

Parameters:
out_buf Pointer to the video decoder output buffer that shall be released.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

Implemented in EmzH264Decoder, EmzMpeg4Decoder, AtiMpeg4Decoder, EmzH264Decoder, EmzMpeg4Decoder, and ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder.

virtual ResultType VideoDecoder::SetAssociatedAudioCh (  UINT32  audio_channel  )  [pure virtual]
 

Sets associated audio channel. The associated audio channel is used for synchronization purposes between audio and video. This feature is only available if the video decoder supports clock (see CodecManager::VideoDecoderInfo).

Parameters:
audio_channel Associated audio channel. If no audio channel is associated, this shall be set to 0xffffffff.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Decoder, EmzH264Decoder, and EmzMpeg4Decoder.

virtual ResultType VideoDecoder::SetConfig (  const UINT8 *  config_stream,
UINT32 &  config_len,
const VideoDecoderParameters &  params,
VideoStreamInfo &  stream_info
)  [pure virtual]
 

Configures the video decoder. It uses the config_stream (if available) and params to configure the video decoder. If config_stream is available, i.e. not equal to 0, the information contained in it will overrule the corresponding parameters from params.

Parameters:
config_stream Pointer to the configuration stream for video decoder. If the config stream is not available, this pointer shall be set to 0. In that case, parameters from params will be used to configure the decoder. Otherwise the parameters extracted from the config_stream will overrule the parameters in params. The MPEG-4 e.g. configuration stream consists of Visual Object Sequence (VOS), Visual Object (VO) and Video Object Layer (VOL) layers.
config_len Length of the configuration stream config_stream in number of bytes. On return it contains the number of bytes consumed.
params Video decoder parameters. If config_stream is not equal to 0, it overrules the parameters in params.
stream_info On return, it contains the encoded stream info.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
Stop

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Decoder, EmzH264Decoder, and EmzMpeg4Decoder.

virtual ResultType VideoDecoder::SetVideoClockTime (  UINT32  time_ms  )  [pure virtual]
 

Sets the video clock time. This feature is only available if the video decoder supports clock (see CodecManager::VideoDecoderInfo).

Parameters:
time_ms Time to be set (in milliseconds).
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Decoder, EmzH264Decoder, and EmzMpeg4Decoder.

void *  context
)  [pure virtual]
 

Starts (asynchronously) the video decoder.

Parameters:
cb_video_decoder_started Pointer to a callback function that is called when this operation has finished.
context Context (e.g. this pointer) that will be passed in the callback function.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
